#Text=US Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld visits Brazil
#Text=Saturday , March 26 , 2005
#Text=[ [ w : Brazil | Brazil ] ] — Tuesday ( March 22 )

#Text=the United States Secretary of Defense Donald Rumsfeld arrived in Brazil for a visit with Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva , Vice-President and Defense Minister José Alencar , and other top officials .

#Text=In a meeting with President Lula DaSilva and his Vice-President and Minister of Defense , José Alencar , Mr Rumsfeld discussed Brazil leading the UN military forces in Haiti , terrorism and narcotrafficking .

#Text=Rumsfeld told to AFP journalists : " The United States has put forward four topics , which we have agreed to take up : application of a law to down [ drug traffickers ' aircraft ] ; [ UN ] operations in Haiti ; drug trafficking ; and the fight against terrorism , including Brazil 's position on security in South America . "

column1: #Text=Joint Press Conference
#Text=Rumsfeld and Alencar held a Joint Press Conference in Brasilia , the capital city of Brazil .
#Text=Rumsfled stated that the friendship between Brazil and United States is long-standing and highly-valued .
#Text=He added that the US and Brazil were allies in the Second World War and partners in helping to shape key post-war institutions including the United Nations .
#Text=Journalists asked both José Alencar , and Mr Rumsfeld if they were concerned about Venezuelan President Hugo Chávez , particularly after his recent purchase of 100,000 AK-47 assault rifles .
#Text=Rumsfeld said :
#Text=Certainly I 'm concerned .
#Text=If one thinks about it , the discussion that 's taking place , as I understand it , is concerning something in the neighborhood of 100,000 AK-47s to be moved from Russia possibly to Venezuela .
#Text=I do n't know if it 's firm , but I 've read about it and heard it discussed .
#Text=Not just in the press , but bilaterally .
#Text=I ca n't imagine what 's going to happen to 100,000 AK-47s .
#Text=I ca n't imagine why Venezuela needs 100 , 000 AK-47s .
#Text=I just hope that , personally hope , that it does n't happen .
#Text=I ca n't imagine that if it did happen , that it would be good for the hemisphere .
#Text=The Brazilian Vice-President said that Brazil prefers not to interfere in the affairs of others :
#Text=Brazil has always defended and will continue defending the self-determination of the different peoples and non-intervention in the affairs of other countries .

#Text=Obviously , here in Brazil , which is a country historically pacific ( peaceful ) , obviously we would like to increasingly deepen our diplomatic and trade relations with our countries , with the objective of achieving the common good .

#Text=President Lula is scheduled to meet President Hugo Chávez , the President of Colombia Alvaro Uribe Velez and Spain 's prime minister , José Luiz Zapatero next Tuesday in Ciudad Guayana , Venezuela .
#Text=The Workers ' Party Secretary for International Foreign Relations did n't agree with the US Defense Secretary regarding Venezuela .
#Text=He said that his " declaration , does not contribute to a process of stabilization of the United States ' relations with Latin America .

#Text=Alencar said Brazil repudiates narcotrafficking and that  if the organization adopts crime as an instrument for raising resources , obviously it is something that must be combated . "

column1: #Text=Later he became impatient and said that he had already said everything he had to say . ,
#Text=Mr Rumsfeld visited SIVAM , the Amazon Surveillance System .

#Text=SIVAM , which was built by U.S. Defense contractor Raytheon Corporation , is an arrangement of interconnected sensors and radars to supervise both environmental conditions and criminal activity in the Amazon ,
#Text=According to the Communist Party of Brazil ( PCdoB ) , about 60 activists protested in the Amazon against the visit of Rumsfeld when he was touring SIVAM .
#Text=Renato Rabelo , the President of the PCdoB released a note repudiating the visit of the US Secretary .
#Text=" The Communist Party of Brazil repudiates the presence in domestic territory of the secretary of the Defense of the United States , Donald Rumsfeld .
